column2: title
column3: description
column10: Are you working with this transcript? Put your name here!
column11: Are you creating a Wikidata item for this transcript? Put your name here!

column2: Clark, Sam -- Radio Personality and Producer of the Record <emph render="italic">Black Americans</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Sam Clark discuss Clark's record <emph render="italic">Black Americans</emph>, a record that addresses Blacks and the United States Bicentennial, and whether or not the Black man is still fighting the United States government.

column2: Greaves, William -- Independent Filmmaker and Producer of <emph render="italic">From These Roots</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and William Greaves discuss how Black filmmakers during the 1960s and 1970s moved to the forefront of independent filmmakers.

column2: Florence Jackson, Carol Banks, and Robert Williams -- Director for the Center for the Humanities and the Arts of the New York City Board of Education, Staff Member of NYU's Institute of Afro-American Affairs, and the Director of Community Affairs for the New York City Bicentennial Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Carol Banks, Florence Jackson, and Robert Williams discuss the booklet<emph render="italic"> Ebony Patriots</emph>, which describes the participation of Black soldiers in various battles of the Revolutionary War in New York City and its surroundings.

column2: Gutman, Dr. Herbert -- Professor and Author of the <emph render="italic">Black Family in Slavery and Freedom</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Herbert Gutman discuss the dynamic of the Black family in the United States, a topic explored in Gutman's book <emph render="italic">Black Family in Slavery and Freedom</emph>.

column2: Maynard, Joan -- Executive Director of the Society for the Preservation of Weeksville and Bedford-Stuyvesant History
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Joan Maynard discuss Weeksville, a community where freed slaves settled during the first half of the 19th Century. They also speak about the Society for the Preservation of Weeksville and Bedford-Stuyvesant History, which was initially created in order to restore three houses within the original perimeter of Weeksville.

column2: Montgomery, Barbara--Actress from La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club's <emph render="italic">Macbeth</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and actress Barbara Montgomery discuss La MaMa's <emph render="italic">Macbeth</emph> production.

column2: Davis, Gordon -- Commissioner of Parks and Recreation for the City of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Gordon Davis discuss the extensive park system of New York City.

column2: Jones, Robert Earle -- Actor, Athlete, Scholar, and Patron of the Arts
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Robert Earle Jones discuss Jones' background and career.

column2: Butts, Dr. Hugh -- Director of the Bronx Psychiatric Center
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Hugh Butts discuss the lack of mental health resources available to the economically-deprived communities in the Bronx.

column2: Cintron, Umberto -- Executive Producer of the Television Show <emph render="italic">Realidades</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Umberto Cintron discuss the problems minority-oriented programs like <emph render="italic">Realidades</emph>, <emph render="italic">Soul</emph>, <emph render="italic">Black Journal</emph>, and <emph render="italic">Black Arts</emph> face in order to remain on television.

column2: Stewart, Ruth Ann -- Assistant Curator for the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture of the New York Public Library
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ruth Ann Stewart discuss the history and collection of the New York Public Library's Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem. They also discuss funding for a new facility since outgrowing its 135th Street location.

column2: Armstead-Johnson, Dr. Helen -- Director of the Afro-American Theater Museum and Professor of English at York College of the City University of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Helen Armstead-Johnson discuss the collection Armstead-Johnson has assembled about the development of Afro-American theatre.

column2: Rhoden, John, Romare Bearden, and Larry Wilson -- A Sculptor, an Artist, and a Representative from Philip Morris, Inc.
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., artists Romare Bearden and John Roden, and sponsor Larry Wilson discuss the Brooklyn Museum of Art's exhibition <emph render="italic">Two Centuries of Black American Art</emph>.

column2: Feinstein, Dr. Alan and Ambassador Ogbu -- Author of <emph render="italic">African Revolutionary: The Life and Times of Nigeria's Aminu Kano</emph>, and the Ambassador of Nigeria
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Dr. Alan Feinstein, and Ambassador Ogbu of Nigeria discuss the life of Nigerian patriot Aminu Kano.

column2: Edley, Christopher -- Executive Director of the United Negro College Fund
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Christopher Edley discuss ways the United Negro College Fund hopes to help 41 of the 108 Black colleges in America survive during a year of economic and political unrest.

column2: Gunn, Bill -- Playwright and Director of the <emph render="italic">Black Picture Show</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Bill Gunn discuss the mid-life crisis theme present in Gunn's play the <emph render="italic">Black Picture Show</emph>, performed at the Vivian Beaumont Theater.

column2: Williams, Mary Lou -- Jazz Pianist
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Mary Lou Williams discuss contemporary music and the golden ages of jazz.

column2: Archer, Lee -- Director of Equal Opportunity of Affairs of the General Foods Corporation and Chairman of the North Street Capital Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Lee Archer discuss how Black business executives are coping with the recession.

column2: Murray, James P. -- Film critic, Film Editor of the <emph render="italic">New York Amsterdam News</emph>, and Editor of <emph render="italic">Black Creation</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and James P. Murray discuss the business aspect of the entertainment industry, including how commercialism affects the relationship between Black performing artists and business entrepreneurs.
column13: James P. Murray at (Q107296500), will expand info; Black Creation doesn't have an entity? Are Q1140177 (Amsterdam News) and Q107019457 (New York Amsterdam News) same thing? Justine (Leftime) will work on these

column2: Figueroa, Jose-Angel -- Poet and Author of the Book <emph render="italic">East 110th Street</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Jose-Angel Figueroa discuss Figueroa's thoughts, feelings, and experiences of East Harlem (El Barrio), which are also included in his book <emph render="italic">East 110th Street</emph>.

column2: Presley, Calvin -- Executive Director of Opportunities Industrialization Center, Inc.
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Calvin Presley speak about the Opportunities Industrial Center, Inc., which began as a protest movement in Philadelphia in the 1960s for a more diverse workplace.

column2: Cudsville, Donald -- President of the Harlem Urban Development Corporation (HUDC)
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Donald Cudsville discuss the Harlem Urban Development Corporation's improvement of housing and economic conditions in Harlem.

column2: Ward, Douglas Turner -- Director of the Negro Ensemble Company and Producer of <emph render="italic">First Breeze of Summer</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Douglas Turner Ward discuss the Broadway play <emph render="italic">First Breeze of Summer</emph>, as well as other developments in Black theatre.

column2: Wein, Joyce -- Associate Producer of Newport in New York Jazz Festival
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Joyce Wein discuss the legacy of jazz music in America and which musicians will be featured in the upcoming Newport in New York Jazz Festival.

column2: Jones, Duane -- Executive Director of the Black Theatre Alliance
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Duane Jones of the Black Theatre Alliance, a coalition of Black theatre and dance groups, discuss new developments in Black theatre and dance at a time when both are growing in importance within the greater theatre and dance community.

column2: Bailey, Peter -- Associate Editor of <emph render="italic">Black Enterprise Magazine</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Peter Bailey discuss the 1975-1976 dance and theater season, including productions on and off Broadway.

column2: Ford, Connie -- Executive Director of the Police Athletic League
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Connie Ford discuss some of the common activities of the Police Athletic League (PAL), which serves nearly 60,000 New York City boys and girls during the winter and summer months. Their discussion occurs shortly after the Criminal Justice Control Commission provides funding for their YES I CAN (Youth Enrichment Services Through Cooperation and Achievement) program aimed at pre-delinquent boys and girls.

column2: Perkins, Joseph -- Director of the Mid-Manhattan Branch of the NAACP's "Operation Rebound Project"
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Joseph Perkins discuss the Mid-Manhattan branch of the NAACP's "Project Rebound," a federally-funded program aimed at finding employment for nearly 1200 ex-offenders.

column2: Barnes, Arthur -- President of the New York Urban Coalition
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Arthur Barnes discuss the future of New York City and how the New York Urban Coalition aims to continue helping minorities and the poor.

column2: Rodgers, Rod -- Choreographer and Director of the Rod Rodgers Dance Company
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Rod Rodgers discuss the role of Black dance companies in the artistic life of America.

column2: Perkins, William Eric and Eric Foner -- Professor from Temple University, and Professor from City College of the City University of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., William Eric Perkins, and Eric Foner discuss controversial new books about Blacks during slavery, including Charles Wesley's <emph render="italic">Roll, Jordan, Roll</emph>.

column2: Lynch, Dr. Hollis -- Professor of History for the Institute of African Studies at Columbia University
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Hollis Lynch discuss how recent problems in South Africa have highlighted the important of Africa in world affairs. They also speak more specifically about Black America's response to South Africa.

column2: Pigatt, Anderson -- Sculptor
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Anderson Pigatt discuss the role of the Black artist at a time when the recognition of the Black artist was increasing across the United States and, in New York City, many Black artists were opening their own galleries.

column2: Herring, Leonard -- Public Relations Specialist for the Film <emph render="italic">Sounder Part 2</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Leonard Herring discuss the promotion of Black films, including <emph render="italic">Sounder Part 2</emph>, a film about a Black family in Louisiana.

column2: Harris, Diane, Frances Gibson, and William Kornblum -- Public Involvement Assistant, Recreation Specialist, and a Member of the Planning Board for the Gateway National Recreation Area
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Diane Harris, Frances Gibson, and William Kornblum discuss planning for the Gateway National Recreation Area, a federal public park.

column2: Holloman, Dr. J. L. S. -- President of the New York City Health and Hospital Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. J. L. S. Holloman discuss the effects of New York City's fiscal crisis on healthcare for Black, Hispanic, and economically-deprived individuals.

column2: Moore, Bob and Jean Carrie Bond -- Representatives from The Council on Interracial Books for Children and the Foundation for Change
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Bob Moore, and Jean Carrie Bond discuss racial stereotypes found in books for children.

column2: Brown, Howard -- Medical Director of <emph render="italic">The New York Times</emph> and Assistant Professor of Clinical Medicine at New York University
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Howard Brown discuss ways to increase the number of Black physicians in the United States.

column2: Patterson, Pat and Fatima Shaik -- Editor-at-Large at <emph render="italic">Black Enterprise Magazine</emph>, Staff Member of the Institute of Afro-American Affairs at NYU and Coordinator for the AEJ Summer Journalism Program
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Pat Patterson, and Fatima Shaik discuss opportunities, like the AEJ Summer Journalism Porgram, that allow minority students to explore the field of journalism.

column2: White, Dr. Herbert -- Representative from the New York City Department of Personnel
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Herbert White discuss how recent cutbacks in New York City have had an adverse impact on minority employees.

column2: Coombs, Orde -- Author and Critic
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Orde Coombs speak about Coombs' tour of the People's Republic of China the previous year.

column2: Patterson, Jamelle and Dianne McDonald -- Founder of the Patterson School, and an Instructor at the Patterson School
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Jamelle Patterson, and Dianne McDonald discuss alternative forms of education for Black youth, using the Patterson School, a private school for Black students, as an example.

column2: Grymes, Sandra -- North East Regional Director for Planned Parenthood Federation, Inc.
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Sandra Grymes discuss population growth as a major social problem.

column2: Thomas, Franklin -- President of the Bedford Stuyvesant Restoration Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Franklin Thomas discuss the accomplishments and the problems of the Bedford Stuyvesant Restoration Corporation, which was founded in 1967 to assist economic development in Brooklyn's Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood.

column2: Thompson, Dr. Leon -- Director of Education Activities for the New York Philharmonic
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Leon Thompson discuss how Lincoln Center is recognizing and honoring the Black presence in classical music.

column2: Jackson Christmas, Dr. June -- Commissioner of Mental Health Services in New York City
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. June Jackson Christmas discuss the increase in mental health issues within the Black community following the recent economic crisis. They also discuss the programs available to the Black community to treat these issues.

column2: Alexander, Jesse and Fred Hill -- YMCA Representatives
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Fred Hill, and Jesse Alexander discuss how YMCA facilities have adapted to better serve inner-city communities.

column2: Jones, Martha and Diane Lacey -- Public Relations Director of the Women's Action Alliance, and Special Assistant to the President of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Martha Jones, and Diane Lacey discuss Black women's criticisms of the women's movement after 1975 was named International Women's Year.

column2: Batchelor, Ron -- Executive Director of Broad Jump
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ron Batchelor discuss the alternative educational program Broad Jump in Harlem.

column2: Clarke, Richard -- Founder of Richard Clarke Associates
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Richard Clarke discuss employement opportunities, including those in major corporations, for recent Black college graduates.

column2: Williams, John A. -- Professor of English at LaGuardia Community College of the City University of New York and Author of <emph render="italic">Mothersill and the Foxes</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and writer John A. Williams discuss his new book <emph render="italic">Mothersill and the Foxes</emph> about the romantic encounters of a Black man in Cleveland and New York.

column2: Goodwin, Steven -- Investment Counselor and Option Specialist for U.S. Option International, Inc.
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Steven Goodwin discuss the status of the stock market in 1975 and the ways in which a decrease in the demand for municipal bonds affected the Black community.

column2: Hinds, Lennox -- National Director of the National Conference of Black Lawyers
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Lennox Hinds discuss how the National Conference of Black Lawyers seeks justice for many minority groups, including Blacks, Hispanics, and the economically-deprived.

column2: Toote, Dr. Gloria --Assistant Secretary of the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Gloria Toote discuss ways laws preventing discrimination in housing can be better enforced.

column2: Saidy, Jay, Bakari Sidibe, and Sam Kinte -- Journalist for the <emph render="italic">Gambian News Bulletin</emph>, Minister of Cultural Affairs, and the Gambian Cousin of Author Alex Haley
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Jay Saidy, Sidibe Bakari, and Sam Kinte discuss the historical novel <emph render="italic">Roots</emph>, as well as Gambia's mission to bridge cultural ties between their country and the United States.

column2: Dinkins, David -- Chairman for the Council of Black Elected Democrats of New York State
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and David Dinkins discuss Black politics and the significance of the Black vote.

column2: Younger, Eddie -- Athlete, Representative from the New York City Department of Recreation, and a Board Member for the Harlem Professional, Inc.
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Eddie Younger discuss contemporary efforts to honor Black athletes for their accomplishments.

column2: King, Woodie, Jr. -- Playwright, Director, and Producer of the Musical <emph render="italic">The Prodigal Sister</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Woodie King, Jr. discuss what constitutes a "Black musical." They also discuss the themes of the successful off-Broadway play <emph render="italic">The Prodigal Sister</emph>.

column2: Kornblum, William, Herb Cables, and Frances Gibson -- Representatives from the Gateway National Recreational Center of the National Park Service
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., William Kornblum, Herb Cables, and Frances Gibson discuss plans for the federally funded Gateway National Park.

column2: Harvin, Al -- Sports Writer for <emph render="italic">The New York Times</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Al Harvin discuss how Black athletes deal with discrimination within the world of sports, an area that grew in importance during the 1960s and 1970s.

column2: Walker, Jim -- Book Editor and Advertising Manager for <emph render="italic">Black Creation</emph> Magazine
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Jim Walker discuss themes in contemporary Black writing and the forms of Black literature they feel are most expressive of the Black experience.

column2: Gourdine, Simon -- Deputy Commissioner for the National Basketball Association
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Simon Gourdine discuss how Black players have made an indelible impression on basketball.

column2: Loney, Dr. Roderick -- Chairman of the Academic Development Division at Medgar Evers College of the City University of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Roderick Loney discuss what certain special educational programs and open enrollment mean for Black and Puerto Rican students entering college.

column2: Harris, Richard and Sergeant James Hargrove -- President of the Vulcan Society and President of The Guardians Association
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Richard Harris, and Sergeant James Hargrove discuss the unique challenges faced by Black policemen and Black firemen within New York City. They also discuss how organizations like The Vulcans and The Guardians attempt to alleviate some of those issues.

column2: Brown, Courtney -- New York State Division of Human Rights
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Courtney Brown discuss the meaning, quotas, and goals of affirmative action.

column2: Yancy, Joe -- Track Athlete and the Co-founder of the New York Pioneer Club
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Joe Yancy discuss Yancy's career in track and an event to honor him at the Waldorf Astoria.

column2: Wright, Samuel -- Councilman for 26th Council District in Brooklyn
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Samuel Wright discuss the role of the councilman and reasons why the Black community and Puerto Rican community are not participating more in city affairs.

column2: Barnes, Arthur -- President of the New York Urban Coalition
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Arthur Barnes discuss the progress and programs of the New York Urban Coalition, which was founded in the late 1960s in order to address unrest within the Black and Puerto Rican communities.

column2: Robinson, David -- Representative from United Harlem Growth, Inc.
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and David Robinson discuss non-profit organizations that are actively reconstructing homes in the inner-city, including United Harlem Growth, Inc.

column2: Sutton, Honorable Percy E. -- Borough President of Manhattan
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Percy Sutton discuss political opportunities and responsibilities of minorities during the Carter administration. They also discuss Sutton's plans for running for the Mayor of New York City.

column2: Williams, Mary Lou and Peter O'Brien -- Jazz Pianist and Producer
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Mary Lou Williams, and Peter O'Brien discuss the significance of the upcoming concert <emph render="italic">Embraced</emph>, a show performed by Williams and Cecil Taylor at Carnegie Hall.

column2: Williams, Franklin -- President of the Phelps-Stokes Fund and former United States Ambassador to Ghana
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Franklin Williams discuss the stuggle for majority rule in Southern Africa and its effects on the rest of the world.

column2: Webb, Dr. Arnold -- Executive Director of the Division of Educational Planning and Support for the New York City Board of Education
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Arnold Webb discuss budget cuts to the New York City Board of Education.

column2: Zollner, Joy -- Representative from the Organization RAINS (Relief for Africans in Need in the Sahel)
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Joy Zollner discuss how the organization RAINS (Relief for Africans in Need in the Sahel) is addressing the African famine.

column2: Fortune, Dr. Hilda -- Professor of Sociology at York College of the City University of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Hilda Fortune discuss whether or not the City University of New York is meeting the needs of minority and low-income youth, including if adequate counseling services are available. They also discuss the diversity of CUNY's faculty.

column2: Turner, Robert -- Firefighter and President of the Vulcan Society
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Robert Turner discuss the recruitment of minority firefighters.

column2: Basil Patterson -- Vice Chairman of the Democratic National Committee
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Basil Patterson discuss the effects of the Carter administration on the Black community.

column2: Bailey, Peter -- Executive Director of the Black Theatre Alliance
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Peter Bailey discuss ways the Black Theatre Alliance promotes the work of 36 theatre and dance organizations.

column2: Furman, Roger -- Playwright and Director of the New Heritage Repertory Theatre in Harlem
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Roger Furman discuss Furman's new play <emph render="italic">Fat Tuesday</emph> about Black life in New Orleans during the 1930s, as well as other developments in Black theater.

column2: Olugebefula, Dr. Ademola and Jean Taylor -- Vice President of the National Board of Directors and Executive Secretary of the National Conference of Artists
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Dr. Ademola Olugebefula, and Jean Taylor discuss the upcoming National Conference of Artists, which involves artists, patrons and educators.

column2: Jackson, Florence -- Director for the Center for the Humanities and Arts for the New York City Board of Education
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Florence Jackson discuss how the television mini-series <emph render="italic">Roots</emph> has inspired school curriculums.

column2: Goldman, Cathy and James Hill -- Representatives from the New York City School Breakfast Committee
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Cathy Goldman, and James Hill discuss reasons why only fifteen percent of children eligible for free breakfast through the Child Nutrition Act are receiving it.

column2: Holloman, Dr. John -- President of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. John Holloman discuss the concerns of the New York City Heath and Hospitals Corporation, a 900 million dollar corporation.

column2: Webb, Dr. Arnold -- Executive Director of the Division of Education of New York City's Board of Education
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Arnold Webb discuss the 1977-1978 school year budget concerns, as well as issues surrounding racial integration.

column2: Killens, John O. -- Author of <emph render="italic">The Resurrection of Alexander Pushkin</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and John O. Killens discuss Killens' new book <emph render="italic">The Resurrection of Alexander Puskin</emph>, which aims to recognize Puskin in America at a time when he was more well-known in the Soviet Union because he was not freely translated into English.

column2: Roberts, Lillian -- Associate Director of District Council #37
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Lillian Roberts discuss unemployment in the Black community.

column2: Robeson, Paul, Jr. -- Head of the Paul Robeson Archives
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Paul Robeson, Jr. discuss fundraising for and the processing of the Paul Robeson Archives, which documents Robeson's life as an actor, singer, and figure of the civil rights movement.

column2: Weathers, Diane and Camille Billops -- Co-Editor of and Contributor to <emph render="italic">Black Creation</emph> Magazine and Faculty Member of the Art Departments at Rutgers University and the City University of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Camille Billops, and Diane Weathers discuss the annual issue of <emph render="italic">Black Creation</emph>, a magazine of Black artistic criticism that covers drama, dance, music, poetry, film, literature, art and other areas of the Black arts.

column2: Lewis, Ed and Marcia Gillespie -- Publisher and Editor of <emph render="italic">Essence</emph> Magazine
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Ed Lewis, and Marcia Gillespie discuss the fifth anniversary of <emph render="italic">Essence</emph>, the first Black woman's magazine.

column2: Cowell, Stanley -- Pianist and a Producer at Strata East Records
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Stanley Cowell discuss the increasing variety of contemporary Black music.

column2: Kennedy, Scott -- Professor of Speech and Drama at Brooklyn College and Author of the Book <emph render="italic">In Search of African Theatre</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Professor Scott Kennedy discuss Kennedy's book <emph render="italic">In Search of African Theatre</emph>.

column2: Mitchem, Dr. John -- Chairman of the Department of Compensatory Programs at Baruch Collge of the City University of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. John Mitchem discuss the decline in college enrollment among Black and Puerto Rican youth, as well as issues these communities face within the university and what services are available to alleviate these issues.

column2: Carr, Ivory -- Assistant Director of Ambulatory Care at Brooklyn Jewish Hospital and Medical Center
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ivory Carr discuss child abuse.

column2: Davis, Robert -- Assistant Commissioner for the New York City Agency for Child Development
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Robert Davis discuss the lack of child care services provided by New York City.

column2: Gidron, Dick -- Business Owner of Dick Gidron Cadillacs
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dick Gidron discuss the scope and meaning of Gidron's business Dick Gidron Cadillacs, which became the first Black-owned Cadillac dealership in New York City when it opened in the Bronx in 1972.

column2: Dempsey, Ellen, Robert Williams, and Florence Jackson -- Two Representatives from the New York City Bicentennial Corporation and the Director of Social Studies for New York City Board of Education
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Ellen Dempsey, Robert Williams, and Florence Jackson discuss the various school and community projects prompted by the Bicentennial.

column2: Holloman, Dr. John -- President of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. John Holloman discuss accomplishments and issues of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation, the largest health organization in the world at the time.

column2: Lewis, Jerry and Marion Bondurant --Executive Director and Assistant Director of Development for the National Medical Fellowships
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Jerry Lewis, and Marion Bondurant discuss the program and objectives of National Medical Fellowships, which serves minority medical students, especially during their first year of medical school.

column2: Suggs, Dr. Dolores -- Assistant to the Dean of Student Affairs at the New York University College of Dentistry
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Dolores Suggs discuss what is being done to train more Black men and women to address dental problems in the Black community.

column2: Morris, Horace -- Executive Director of the New York Urban League
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Horace Morris discuss the mission of the New York Urban League to serve the minorities of New York.

column2: Wallace, Robert E. -- Executive Director of the National Interagency Council on Smoking and Health
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Robert E. Wallace discuss ways to decrease smoking in the United States.

column2: White, Louis -- Director of the Wiltwyck Schools
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Louis White discuss the efficacy of residential treatment and foster home care, and whether or not there is racism in the area of judicial placement.

column2: Wilkins, Roger -- Urban Affairs Columnist for <emph render="italic">The New York Times</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Roger Wilkins discuss the affect of the Carter administration on the Black community.

column2: Frazier, Cliff -- Administrator of Third World Cinema
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Cliff Frazier discuss trends in Black filmmaking, including the roles portrayed by Black actors in Black films.

column2: Turman, Glynn and Loretta Green -- Actor and Actress from the Broadway Play <emph render="italic">What the Wine-Sellers Buy</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Glynn Turman, and Loretta Green speak about Black Broadway actors, actresses, and writers.

column2: Lenior, Henry and Livingston Francis -- Group Vice President of the YMCA of Greater New York and the Executive Director of the Harlem YMCA
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Henry Lenior, and Livingston Francis begin by discussing the Harlem YMCA dinner that was organized to honor Secretary of War Clifford Alexander, but they also discuss more generally how the programming of the YMCA has expanded, allowing the YMCA to become the social instiution for the Black community rather than just a health club.

column2: Hutson, Jean Blackwell -- Chief of the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Jean Blackwell Hutson discuss how a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities allowed the Schomburg Center to gain bibliographic control over its collections. They discuss different aspects of the center's history with the New York Public Library and speak about fundraising efforts for a new, larger structure.

column2: Henderson, Butler T. -- Executive Director of the Earl Warren Legal Training Program of the NAACP's Legal Defense and Education Fund
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Butler T. Henderson discuss the recruitment and training of Black lawyers.

column2: McDougald, Drew -- Director of the Queens Branch of the New York Urban League and Carlisle Towery and Executive Director of the Greater Jamaica Development Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Drew McDougald, and Carlisle Towery discuss the social development and the economic potential for the borrough of Queens. Of interest was the closing of Macy's Jamaica branch.

column2: Williams, Charles T. "Chuck" -- Vice President of the Schenley Affiliated Brands Corporation and Member of the Board for the Jackie Robinson Foundation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Charles T. "Chuck" Williams discuss how Jackie Robinson -- a man they both knew well -- created opportunities for Black athletes, as well as fought for social, economic, and political justice for all Americans. However, a cause of particular interest to Robinson was providing educational and recreational opportunities for economically-deprived Black children. As a result, the Jackie Robinson Foundation identified its objective as providing support for Black children through an internship program.

column2: Barnes, Arthur and Reverend Frederick E. Dennard -- President of the Urban Coalition and Executive Director of Harlem Interfaith Counseling Service
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Reverend Frederick E. Dennard, and Arthur Barnes discuss the mental health and spiritual guidance services offered by the New York Urban Coalition's Interfaith Counseling Services project in Harlem.

column2: Lynch, Professor Hollis -- Political Scientist and African History Specialist from Columbia University
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Professor Hollis Lynch speak about the political state of South Africa and its impact, especially its economic affect on the rest of the world.

column2: Huggins, Dr. Nathan -- Professor of History at Columbia University and Author of <emph render="italic">Black Odyssey</emph>
column3: During the 1970s, books on slavery proliferated. Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Nathan Huggins discuss the argument Huggins makes in his book <emph render="italic">Black Odyssey</emph>. He argues America was a slave society rather than a free society, or rather slavery was an indigenous part of the development of America.

column2: Bullins, Ed -- Author of <emph render="italic">The Taking of Miss Janie</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ed Bullins discuss Bullin's piece <emph render="italic">The Taking of Miss Janie</emph>, a play about Black and white relations during the 1960s. At the time of their discussion, the play was being performed at the Mitzi Newhouse Theatre in Lincoln Center.

column2: Mays, Charles and Herb Douglas -- Director of the Black Athletes Hall of Frame, and Vice President of Shefflin Corporation and Chairman of the Board of the Black Athletes Hall of Fame
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and athletes Charles Mays and Herb Douglas discuss the formation and significance of the Black Athletes Hall of Fame.

column2: Bryant, Linda -- Director of the Just Above Midtown Gallery
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Linda Bryant discuss the opening of the Just Above Midtown Gallery at 50 West 57 Street, a gallery formed to promote 20th-century Afro-American artists.

column2: Artist, Ruth -- Interior Decorator
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ruth Artist discuss interior decorating.

column2: Patterson, Basil -- Vice Chairman of the Democratic National Committee.
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Basil Patterson discuss the potential impact of the Watergate scandal on Black America.

column2: Broughton, Modeen and Cheryl Goggins -- Coordinator and Assistant Coordinator of the Congressional Black Caucus Dinner
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Modeen Broughton, and Cheryl Goggins discuss the significance of the Black Caucus Dinner, an important political affair of the year for Black officials, and how the funds raised by the event are utilized.

column2: Pinero, Miguel -- Playwright and Author of <emph render="italic">Short Eyes</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Miguel Pinero discuss Pinero's play <emph render="italic">Short Eyes</emph>.

column2: Meminger, Dean -- American Basketball Player of the New York Knicks and the Atlanta Hawks
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dean Meminger discuss how Black athletes are contributing to their communities.

column2: Williams, Bob and Ronald Lee Gaudreau -- Executive Vice President of the New York City Bicentennial Corporation, and the Director of Community Programs for the New York City Bicentennial Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Bob Williams, and Ronald Lee Gaudreau discuss New York City events surrounding the American Bicentennial.

column2: Higgins, Chester, Jr. -- Photographer
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Chester Higgins, Jr. discuss the role and impact of the Black photographer.

column2: Green, Essie -- Social Services Research Specialist
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Essie Green discuss how changes to New York's Social Services Law would impact the Black community.

column2: Williams, Bob -- Founder of the Sports Foundation and the Director of Community Programs for the New York City Bicentennial Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Bob Williams discuss whether or not there is too much emphasis on athletics in the Black community.

column2: Bertram, Cliff -- Track Coach at New York University
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Cliff Bertram discuss the future of track at New York University and the greater New York metropolitan area.

column2: Williams, Charles -- Assistant Council of the NAACP Legal Defense Fund
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Charles Williams discuss racism and the guidelines the NAACP Legal Defense Fund uses when selecting discrimination cases for representation.

column2: Rowe, Billy and John Procope -- Journalist, and the Publisher of <emph render="italic">NY Amsterdam News</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Billy Rowe, and John Procope discuss the 150th Anniversary of the founding of the Black press, which began with Samuel Cornish's and John B. Russwurm's newspaper <emph render="italic">Freedom's Journal</emph>.

column2: Stewart, Ellen -- La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ellen Stewart discuss international theatre, including La MaMa's decision to begin touring Europe in 1965 when critics were not reviewing their shows.

column2: Cooper, Jocelyn and Patricia Dempsey -- Coordinator of Foods and Nutrition of the Council Against Poverty and the Community Development Agency, and the Deputy Director of Food-Stamp Alert
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Jocelyn Cooper, and Patricia Dempsey discuss why over a million Black individuals who are eligible for food stamps are not receiving such benefits.

column2: Barron, Allan -- Publisher of <emph render="italic">Black Sports Magazine</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Allan Barron discuss the Black Sports Hall of Fame, created by <emph render="italic">Black Sports Magazine</emph>.

column2: Burns, Dr. Haywood -- Associate Professor of Law at the New York University School of Law
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Haywood Burns discuss the controversial appointment of Griffin Bell to the position of Attorney General of the United States.

column2: French, Arthur -- Performer in the Negro Ensemble Company's Play <emph render="italic">Brownsville Raid</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Arthur French discuss how, on August 13, 1906, 167 Black soldiers of the 25th Infantry Division were dishonorably discharged by Theodore Roosevelt for their participation in the now infamous Brownsville Raid.

column2: Ward, Willie and Howard Scheffey -- President, and Past President and Chairman of the Board of the New York City Black Policemen's Organization The Guardians
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Willie Ward, and Howard Scheffey discuss Black policemen in New York City, their affiliation with the Police Benevolent Association (PBA), and the way in which criminal justice and law enforcement is applied within the Black community. Their discussion occurs shortly after The Guardians Association of the Police Department of the City of New York, the Black policeman's organization of New York City, endorsed implementation of a resolution to terminante affiliation with the PBA.

column2: Deas, Dr. Gerald -- Physician from the Department of Internal Medicine at Jamaica Hospital
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Gerald Deas discuss the consumption of laundry starch by tens of thousands of Black Americans and how its consumption leads to a higher proportion of iron deficiency anemia in the Black population.

column2: Bondurant, Marion, Dr. Beny J. Primm, and Clementine Butts -- Director of Development, Co-Chairperson, and Benefit Committee Chairperson from National Medical Fellowships, Inc.
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Clementine Butts, Dr. Beny J. Primm, and Marion Bondurant discuss the fundraising efforts of the National Medical Fellowship, Inc. for Black medical students.

column2: Patterson, Pat -- Editor-At-Large at <emph render="italic">Black Enterprise</emph> Magazine and Instructor from the Association for Journalism's Summer Institute for Minorities
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Pat Patterson discuss reasons why only two percent of those employed in the field of journalism are from minority groups.

column2: Barron, Allan -- Publisher of <emph render="italic">Black Sports Magazine</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Allan Barron discuss how sports became a major part of Black life in America.

column2: Taylor, Emory -- Director of the Harlem Opera Society
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Emory Taylor discuss the history and work of the Harlem Opera Society, which was responsible for 40 performances a year, including two to three Black operas in the New York metropolitan area.

column2: Covington, William -- Special Assistant to the Project Director of the Urban League's Youth Enrichment Program
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and William Covington discuss how the Urban League's Youth Enrichment Program tries to help youth placed on probabtion by the courts through activities like outdoor living and education.

column2: Hamilton, Dr. Charles -- Political Scientist and President of the Metropolitan Applied Research Center
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Charles Hamilton discuss the future of the Metropolitan Applied Research Center, a non-profit organization concerned with research on matters of urgency for the Black community.

column2: King, Angela -- Social Affairs Officer of the United Nations
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Angela King discuss the creation of International Women's Year by the United Nations in order to recognize accomplishments and discuss problems faced by women across the globe.

column2: Walker, Dr. Wyatt T. -- Canaan Baptist Church of Harlem
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Wyatt T. Walker discuss the role of the Black church, which, historically, was the most pervasive social force within the Black community.

column2: Carr, Ivory -- Director of the Outpatient Department at the Jewish Hospital and Medical Center of Brooklyn
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ivory Carr discuss how outpatient medical care for many New Yorkers may be threatened by proposed cutbacks in the Ghetto Medicine Program.

column2: Rainford, Patricia Luces -- Associate Director of the Bronx Municipal Hospital Center
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Patricia Luces Rainford discuss the future of New York's 18 municipal hospitals during New York's fiscal crisis.

column2: Higginson, Vy -- Founder and Publisher of <emph render="italic">Unique New York</emph> Magazine
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Vy Higginson discuss Higginson's transition from radio personality to publisher of <emph render="italic">Unique New York</emph>, a lifestyle magazine and entertainment guide for the New York's Black community.

column2: Killens, John O. -- Author of the Historic Novel <emph render="italic">Young Blood</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and novelist John O. Killens discuss the state of Black writing.

column2: Christmas, Dr. June -- Commissioner for New York City's Department of Mental Health and Mental Retardation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. June Christmas discuss some of the mental health problems affecting the New York community, including drug abuse, suicide, emotional instability, psychosis, and mental retardation.

column2: Lacy, Diane -- Coordinator of the National Conference on Drug Abuse
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Diane Lacy discuss some of the ways the National Conference on Drug Abuse could affect drug problems in America. They also discuss the role of the professional woman in eliminating such problems within the Black community.

column2: Finch, Connie -- Sophomore NYU Student involved in Black Student Affairs
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Connie Finch discuss contemporary Black student political views and how they differ from the Black student activism of the 1960s.

column2: Russell, Harvey C. -- Vice President of PepsiCo and Co-Chairman of the Congressional Black Caucus Dinner
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Harvey C. Russell discuss the purpose of the Congressional Black Caucus and supporters of their annual fundraising dinner in Washington D.C.

column2: Addison, Gayle -- Writer, Critic and Associate Professor of English at Baruch College of the City University of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Gayle Addison discuss the status of Black writing.

column2: Moses, Gil -- Director of the Broadway Play <emph render="italic">Ain't Supposed to Die a Natural Death</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Gil Moses discuss the Broadway play <emph render="italic">Ain't Supposed to Die a Natural Death</emph>.

column2: Dorsey, Carolyn -- Instructor at the NYU School of Education and Fellow at the NYU Institute of Afro-American Affairs
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Carolyn Dorsey discuss whether or not Black studies has fullfilled its potential and identify what they believe to be the areas of greatest importance within the field of Black studies.

column2: Capers, Virginia -- Actress in the Musical <emph render="italic">Raisin</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Virginia Capers discuss the musical <emph render="italic">Raisin</emph>.

column2: White, Dr. Herbert L. -- Testing Specialist and the Director of the Executive Unit of the Rep Program of the New York City Department of Personnel
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Herbert L. White discuss the fairness of civil service testing.

column2: Dempsey, Ellen and Charlotte Frank -- Project Coordinator for the New York City Bicentennial Corporation and a Representative from the New York City Board of Education "Scholars Series"
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Ellen Dempsey, and Charlotte Frank discuss curriculumn development in New York City schools with discipline issues and overcrowding.

column2: Kemp, Emme -- Singer and Composer
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Emme Kemp discuss ways a composer can combine the popular and the classical in Black music.

column2: Sparks, George and William Alston -- Grand Master of the King George Grand Lodge and Publisher of the<emph render="italic"> Long Island Courier</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., George Sparks, and William Alston discuss the role of the Black mason.

column2: Patterson, John, Jr. -- President of the South Bronx Economic Development Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and John Patterson, Jr. discuss the Bronx businesses aided by the South Bronx Economic Decvelopment Corporation.

column2: Martin, Bob -- Director of Communications for the Capital Formation Corporation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Bob Martin discuss the successes and failures of Black business and the future of Black economic development.

column2: Sandler, Joan -- Executive Director of the Black Theatre Alliance
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Joan Sandler discuss the fall season of Black theater in New York, as well as what goals can be met when theaters come together through collectives like the Black Theatre Alliance.

column2: Neal, James -- Representative from National Artists Coalition, Inc.
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and James Neale discuss themes in contemporary Black art, as well as how the public can help Black artists.

column2: Bullock, Kathleen, Mark Millander, and Terry Smith -- Students from the New York City Executive High School Intern Program
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and students Kathleen Bullock, Mark Millander, and Terry Smith discuss the professional development opportunities made available by the New York City Executive High School Intern Program.

column2: Alston, Dr. Lester -- Clinical Psychologist and Associate Professor of Education at Baruch College of the City University of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Lester Alston discuss mental health issues in the Black community.

column2: McIntyre, Diane -- Choreographer for the Negro Ensemble Company's Production of <emph render="italic">The Great MacDaddy</emph> and Founder of the Company, Sounds and Motion
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Diane McIntyre discuss the field of choreography and McIntyre's company Sounds and Motion.

column2: Byer, Lavenia, Jeanette Fields, and Andrew Henderson -- Coordinator, Chairperson and Consultant from the Freedom Funds United Foundation
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Lavenia Byer, Andrew Henderson, and Jeanette Fields speak about the programs of the Freedom Funds Cultural Train, which were developed to bring the Black community together and to create a more positive image of the community.

column2: Chance, Cathy -- Special Assistant for Urban Affairs at the Metropolitan Museum of Art
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Cathy Chance discuss programming of the Metropolitan Museum of Art that is relevant to the Black and Hispanic communities of New York.

column2: Sullivan, Maxine -- Singer
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and singer Maxine Sullivan discuss Sullivan's singing career and the history of Black music.

column2: Patterson, Basil -- Vice Chairman of the Democratic National Committee
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Basil Patterson discuss the Black political scene after Watergate.

column2: Jordan, Richard -- Director of the Urban Services Division of the Boys Clubs of America
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Richard Jordan discuss how the urban divisions of the Boys Clubs of American seek to offer youths an alternative residence, a home away from home, as well as access to other services and leisurely activities.

column2: Huggins, Dr. Nathan -- Professor of History at Columbia University and Author of <emph render="italic">Black Odyssey</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Nathan Huggins speak about the reception of Huggins' book <emph render="italic">Black Odyssey</emph>, which tells the history of the African-American people with an emphasis on slavery.

column2: Davis, Nat -- Assistant Director for the Community-Oriented Drug Education Program of Harlem Teams for Self-Help
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Nat Davis address the problem of drug addiction in inner-city communities like Harlem.

column2: Goodwin, Steven -- Investment Executive and Investment Counselor at Hayden Stone and Company
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Steven Goodwin discuss the basic principles of the stock market and why the Black community should be interested in the market.

column2: Boyd, Dr. Robert -- Associate Professor of Dentistry and Chairman of the Minority Recruitment Committee at the Brookdale Dental Center for the NYU College of Dentistry
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Robert Boyd discuss the number of Black dentists in the New York area and recruiting minorities to the dental professions.

column2: Salamu, Mashujaa A. and Khaliq Abdul Al Rouf -- Musicians from the Group Ensemble, Al Salaam
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Khaliq Abdul Al Rouf, and Mashujaa A. Salamu discuss the composition and reception of new Black music, as well as the creation of music-related businesses.

column2: Barron, Allan -- Editor and Publisher of <emph render="italic">Black Sports Magazine</emph>
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Allan Barron discuss some of the persisting, negative racial attitudes in sports despite the growing number of successful Black athletes.

column2: Carter, Dr. Ralph D. -- Assistant Professor of History at Livingston College of Rutgers University
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Ralph D. Carter discuss the Black community's participation in and perspective on the American Bicentennial.

column2: Jordan, Richard -- Director of National Urban Services for the Boys Club of America
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Richard Jordan discuss the commitment of the Boys Clubs of America to inner-city, minority youth.

column2: Anglada, Mario -- Executive Director of ASPIRA of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Mario Anglada discuss social problems of Puerto Rican youth, including competition between Blacks and Puerto Ricans for educational funding. They also discuss how non-profit organizations like ASPIRA can help with these issues.

column2: Taylor, Cecil -- Musician
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Cecil Taylor discuss the themes, forms, and meanings of Black music.

column2: Jeffries, Dr. Leonard -- Director of Black Studies at the City College of New York
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Leonard Jeffries discuss the future of Black Studies and which courses seem to be most successful for students.

column2: Wright, Dr. Stephen -- Vice President of the College Entrance Examination Board
column3: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. Stephen Wright discuss higher education opportunities for Black students.
